docs.lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appear daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.
docs.abstract: The status of privacy online, how New York cab drivers cheated customers and other consumer-focused items from Wednesday's Times.

docs.lead_paragraph: To close a structural deficit, Gov. Christopher J. Christie’s budget focuses almost exclusively on cutting spending rather than raising revenue.

docs.lead_paragraph: After a private lunch with President Obama on Tuesday, the chairman of the Democratic National Committee, Tim Kaine, said of the health care bill, ''This is the right thing to do, but it's also good politics.'' Mr. Kaine said Mr. Obama had not asked him to talk to wavering Democrats, although Mr. Kaine did plan to meet with lawmakers. He would not say with whom.
docs.abstract: Democratic National Committee chairman Tim Kaine, following private lunch with Pres Obama, praises health care bill, saying it is the right thing to do and is also good politics; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: The number of uninsured adults and children in California swelled by 28 percent from 2007 to 2009, according to a report on Tuesday by researchers at the University of California, Los Angeles. One quarter of the state's population is now uninsured, according to the analysis, and less than half of those with insurance receive it through employers.
docs.abstract: Report by researchers at University of California, Los Angeles, indicates that number of uninsured adults and children in California swelled by 28 percent from 2007 to 2009, to 8.2 million; cites job loss during recession (M)
docs.snippet: The number of uninsured adults and children in California swelled by 28 percent from  2007 to 2009, according to a report on Tuesday by researchers at the University of California, Los Angeles.     One quarter of the state's population is now...

docs.lead_paragraph: Representative Dennis Kucinich, Democrat of Ohio, voted against the House health care bill in November because he prefers a fully government-run, Medicare-for-all approach. He felt the Democrats' bill simply did not go far enough to eliminate the mostly private, employer-sponsored health insurance system.

headline.main: Kucinich to Announce His Position on Health Care

docs.abstract: With Democrats scrambling for votes in the House, Representative Dennis Kucinich of Ohio -- who voted against the House health care bill in November -- will announce his position on Wednesday.
docs.snippet: With Democrats scrambling for votes in the House, Representative Dennis Kucinich of Ohio -- who voted against the House health care bill in November -- will announce his position on Wednesday.

headline.main: Study Finds Almost 1 in 4 Uninsured in California
